meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a dunce.
meanings.sent1: The duncical student struggled with basic math problems.
meanings.sent2: Her duncical hat had a large propeller on top.
meanings.sent3: The duncical clown kept tripping over his own oversized shoes.
meanings.sent4: His duncical behavior in class made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent5: The duncical expression on his face showed confusion and bewilderment.

meanings.definition: Foolish or stupid in behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: She made a duncical decision to wear mismatched socks to the party.
meanings.sent2: His duncical remarks offended many people.
meanings.sent3: The duncical puppy chased its own tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The duncical choice to jump into the lake fully clothed left him shivering.
meanings.sent5: The duncical error in the report was quickly corrected by the editor.
